title: Mark Spitz
summary: Mark Andrew Spitz (born February 10, 1950) is an American former competitive swimmer and nine-time Olympic champion.  He was the most successful athlete at the 1972 Summer Olympics in Munich, winning seven gold medals, all in world record time. This was an achievement that lasted for 36 years until it was surpassed  by fellow American Michael Phelps, who won eight golds at the 2008 Summer Olympics in Beijing.
